item.title: Philippines receives over 200,000 doses of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine
item.description: The Philippines welcomed 207,090 doses of government-purchased COVID-19 vaccine developed by Pfizer and its German partner BioNTech.

item.title: P1.6 billion worth of shabu seized, 2 suspects nabbed in Cavite
item.description: Authorities seized more than P1 billion worth of shabu and arrested two drug suspects in a buy-bust operation in Dasmariñas, Cavite.

item.title: Duterte to partymates: Ensure integrity of elections
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte on Saturday urged his PDP-Laban partymates to ensure the integrity of the May 2022 national elections.

item.title: NCR mayors to discuss single policy on allowing minors, seniors outdoors
item.description: National Capital Region (NCR) mayors are set to discuss a uniform policy on allowing minors and seniors to go outside amid the enforcement of a COVID-19 Alert Level 3 in Metro Manila.

item.title: Darwin microscope to be sold at auction, seen to fetch $480K
item.description: LONDON--A microscope Charles Darwin gave his son Leonard and which has remained in the family for nearly 200 years is headed for auction in December, and is expected to fetch up to $480,000.

item.title: Thieves break into Nueva Ecija ATM, steal P5 million in cash
item.description: Thieves in Nueva Ecija's Gapan City broke into an automated teller machine at a mall and made off with over P5 million in cash.

item.title: Duterte: Gov t expediting Marawi rehab
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte on Saturday vowed to expedite the rehabilitation program for war-torn Marawi as the government marked the fourth year of the city s liberation from the ISIS-inspired Maute group.

item.title: Maring leaves 22 dead; 17 other reported fatalities being validated -NDRRMC
item.description: The death toll from Severe Tropical Storm Maring climbed to 22, with 17 more reported fatalities still being validated, the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) said Saturday.

item.title: 720K doses of Sputnik V vaccine arrive in Philippines
item.description: The Philippines received at least 720,000 doses of the Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine, procured by the national government.

item.title: 7,772 new Philippine COVID-19 cases recorded; active tally at 85,048
item.description: The Department of Health (DOH) on Saturday reported 7,772 new COVID-19 cases, bringing the nationwide tally to 2,713,509.

item.title: WHO did not specify any vaccine that needs a third dose -DOH
item.description: The World Health Organization (DOH) did not specify any brand of vaccine that needed to be administered a third time, the Department of Health (DOH) said Saturday.

item.title: IATF OKs Comelec request to simulate voting amid pandemic
item.description: The government s COVID-19 task force has approved the Commission on Elections (Comelec) request to conduct voting simulations on October 23 in San Juan City in preparation for the May 2022 polls.

item.title: Labor leader Leody De Guzman bares 9 senatorial bets for Eleksyon 2022
item.description: Presidential aspirant and labor leader Leodegario "Ka Leody" de Guzman on Saturday revealed his nine senatorial bets for the upcoming May 2022 elections.

item.title: Myanmar junta chief excluded from summit --ASEAN
item.description: Myanmar's junta chief will be excluded from an upcoming ASEAN summit, the group said Saturday, a rare rebuke as concerns rise over the military government's commitment to defusing a bloody crisis.

item.title: No adverse reactions reported on first day of teen COVID-19 inoculations -DOH
item.description: The Department of Health (DOH) on Saturday said there were no adverse reactions reported on the first day of COVID-19 inoculations of adolescents aged 15 to 17 years old.
